verses.roman:
āśā hi paramaṁ duḥkhaṁ
nairāśyaṁ paramaṁ sukham
yathā sañchidya kāntāśāṁ
sukhaṁ suṣvāpa piṅgalā

synonyms: aśā—material desire; hi—certainly; paramam—the greatest; duḥkham—unhappiness; nairāśyam—freedom from material desires; paramam—the greatest; sukham—happiness; yathā—in that way; sañchidya—completely cutting off; kānta—for lovers; āśām—the desire; sukham—happily; suṣvāpa—she slept; piṅgalā—the former prostitute, Piṅgalā.
translation: Material desire is undoubtedly the cause of the greatest unhappiness, and freedom from such desire is the cause of the greatest happiness. Therefore, completely cutting off her desire to enjoy so-called lovers, Piṅgalā very happily went to sleep.
